Laureate: Frederick Gowland Hopkins ( shared with Christiaan Eijkman )
Rationale: for his discovery of the growth-stimulating vitamins

Laureate: George Paget Thomson ( shared with Clinton Davisson )
Relation: Professor of Physics 1930-1952 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1955
Rationale: for their experimental discovery of the diffraction of electrons by crystals

Laureate: Ernst Boris Chain ( shared with Alexander Fleming and Howard Florey )
Relation: Professor of Bacteriology , 1928-1948 , St Mary 's Hospital Medical School
Rationale: for the discovery of penicillin and its curative effect in various infectious diseases

Laureate: Alexander Fleming ( shared with Ernst Boris Chain and Howard Florey )
Relation: Professor of Bacteriology , 1928-1948 , St Mary 's Hospital Medical School
Rationale: for the discovery of penicillin and its curative effect in various infectious diseases

Relation: Professor of Physics , 1953-65 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1967
Rationale: for his development of the Wilson cloud chamber method , and his discoveries therewith in the fields of nuclear physics and cosmic radiation

Laureate: Cyril Norman Hinshelwood ( shared with Nikolay Semenov )
Rationale: for their researches into the mechanism of chemical reactions

Laureate: Andrew Huxley ( shared with John Carew Eccles and Alan Lloyd Hodgkin )
Rationale: for their discoveries concerning the ionic mechanisms involved in excitation and inhibition in the peripheral and central portions of the nerve cell membrane

Laureate: George Porter ( shared with Manfred Eigen and Ronald George Wreyford Norrish )
Relation: Visiting Professor , Department of Biology 1978-2002 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1987
Rationale: for their studies of extremely fast chemical reactions , effected by disturbing the equilibrium by means of very short pulses of energy

Laureate: Derek Barton ( shared with Odd Hassel )
Relation: Professor of Organic Chemistry , 1957-1978 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1980 ; Emeritus Professor , 1978
Rationale: for their contributions to the development of the concept of conformation and its application in chemistry

Relation: Professor of Electron Physics , 1958-67 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1970
Rationale: for his invention and development of the holographic method

Laureate: Rodney Robert Porter ( shared with Gerald Edelman )
Relation: Pfizer Professor of Immunology , ; St Mary 's Hospital Medical School 1960-1967
Rationale: for their discoveries concerning the chemical structure of antibodies

Laureate: Geoffrey Wilkinson ( shared with Ernst Otto Fischer )
Relation: Professor of Inorganic Chemistry , 1956-1996 ; Emeritus Professor 1988 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1993
Rationale: for their pioneering work , performed independently , on the chemistry of the organometallic , so called sandwich compounds

Laureate: Abdus Salam ( shared with Sheldon Lee Glashow and Steven Weinberg )
Relation: Professor of Theoretical Physics , 1957-1996 ; Emeritus Professor , 1993 ; Fellow of Imperial College , 1994
Rationale: for their contributions to the theory of the unified weak and electromagnetic interaction between elementary particles , including , inter alia , the prediction of the weak neutral current
